Version

This is version 2 of the file.

Purpose

Dynamic class for OFTL Lua interface.

Author

Daniel “q66” Kolesa quak.nosp@m.er66@gmai.nosp@m.l.com

License

This file is licensed under MIT.  See COPYING.txt for more information.

lua

namespace lua

Dynamic

struct Dynamic: Function

This is a “Dynamic”, a generic object that can behave as a value, a bit like table, function, etc.  It can well represent a value to call methods on:

lua::Dynamic s = lua.wrap<lua::Dynamic>("foo");
// retvals is a tuple of two types, const char* and int.
// they represent the results of gsub method call on Lua string.
auto retvals = s.method<const char*, int>("gsub", "foo", "bar");
const char *s = types::get<0>(retvals);
int n = types::get<1>(retvals);

Inherits Function.

method

template<typename... T, typename... U> typename Function::Call_Ret_Type<T...>::type method(
   const char *name,
   const U&... args
) const

See Function.call.  This is the same, except that it performs a method call on the object instead of function call.  The name of the method is specified through the first argument.
